meanings.definition: Having impaired vision due to aging
meanings.sent1: My presbyopic grandfather needs reading glasses to see small print.
meanings.sent2: As people get older, they may become presbyopic and require bifocals.
meanings.sent3: The presbyopic owl struggled to read the tiny mouse print on the menu.
meanings.sent4: Her presbyopic eyes were like old windows, foggy and unclear.
meanings.sent5: The presbyopic vision of the ancient tortoise made it hard for him to spot predators.

meanings.definition: A person with impaired vision due to aging
meanings.sent1: The presbyopic often rely on glasses to help them see better.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother is a presbyopic who enjoys large-print books.
meanings.sent3: The presbyopic at the library accidentally picked up a large-print book for toddlers.
meanings.sent4: In the land of the presbyopic, the one-eyed man is king.
meanings.sent5: The presbyopic in the group led the way, carefully navigating the dimly lit path.
